text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/38ddf333f6b2806b0ea2dd052ee1cd50dd7f4525|patch 8.2.1329: Vim9: cannot define global function inside :def function>
patch 8.2.1329: Vim9: cannot define global function inside :def function

Problem:    Vim9: cannot define global function inside :def function.
Solution:   Assign to global variable instead of local. (closes #6584)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1329: Vim9: cannot define global function inside :def function · vim/vim@38ddf33
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1329: Vim9: cannot define global function inside :def function · vim/vim@38ddf33
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: cannot define global function inside :def function. Solution: Assign to global variable instead of local. (closes #6584)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/3a53ec8bdddccf06a0e9db263277c50a6015294d|patch 8.2.1330: Github workflow takes longer than needed>
patch 8.2.1330: Github workflow takes longer than needed

Problem:    Github workflow takes longer than needed.
Solution:   Do two test runs in parallel instead of sequentially. (Ken Takata,
            closes #6579)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1330: Github workflow takes longer than needed · vim/vim@3a53ec8
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1330: Github workflow takes longer than needed · vim/vim@3a53ec8
attachments.text: Problem: Github workflow takes longer than needed. Solution: Do two test runs in parallel instead of sequentially. (Ken Takata, closes #6579)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/badd8486f7442bfcf55e0234ece80488958e7114|patch 8.2.1331: Vim9: :echo with two lists doesn't work>
patch 8.2.1331: Vim9: :echo with two lists doesn't work

Problem:    Vim9: :echo with two lists doesn't work.
Solution:   Do not skip white space before []. (closes #6552)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1331: Vim9: :echo with two lists doesn't work · vim/vim@badd848
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1331: Vim9: :echo with two lists doesn't work · vim/vim@badd848
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: :echo with two lists doesn't work. Solution: Do not skip white space before []. (closes #6552)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/ce6583568ff5b3e0e6438b37ede2c80bedffba10|patch 8.2.1332: Vim9: memory leak when using nested global function>
patch 8.2.1332: Vim9: memory leak when using nested global function

Problem:    Vim9: memory leak when using nested global function.
Solution:   Delete the function when deleting the instruction.  Disable test
            that still causes a leak.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1332: Vim9: memory leak when using nested global function · vim/vim@ce65835
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1332: Vim9: memory leak when using nested global function · vim/vim@ce65835
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: memory leak when using nested global function. Solution: Delete the function when deleting the instruction. Disable test that still causes a leak.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/af8edbb8dc551aaf2105a4d77b3d8495da239ef0|patch 8.2.1333: Vim9: memory leak when using nested global function>
patch 8.2.1333: Vim9: memory leak when using nested global function

Problem:    Vim9: memory leak when using nested global function.
Solution:   Swap from and to when copying the lines.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1333: Vim9: memory leak when using nested global function · vim/vim@af8edbb
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1333: Vim9: memory leak when using nested global function · vim/vim@af8edbb
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: memory leak when using nested global function. Solution: Swap from and to when copying the lines.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/b53da7918c643ef4de1256c37bc8b92413e6dcec|patch 8.2.1334: Github workflow timeout needs tuning>
patch 8.2.1334: Github workflow timeout needs tuning

Problem:    Github workflow timeout needs tuning
Solution:   Use a 10 minute timeout. Fail when timing out. (Ken Takata,
            closes #6590)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1334: Github workflow timeout needs tuning · vim/vim@b53da79
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1334: Github workflow timeout needs tuning · vim/vim@b53da79
attachments.text: Problem: Github workflow timeout needs tuning Solution: Use a 10 minute timeout. Fail when timing out. (Ken Takata, closes #6590)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/4e1d8bd79b87b120bd40afe0eba54a419f8c3aee|patch 8.2.1335: CTRL-C in the GUI doesn't interrupt>
patch 8.2.1335: CTRL-C in the GUI doesn't interrupt

Problem:    CTRL-C in the GUI doesn't interrupt. (Sergey Vlasov)
Solution:   Recognize "C" with CTRL modifier as CTRL-C. (issue #6565)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1335: CTRL-C in the GUI doesn't interrupt · vim/vim@4e1d8bd
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1335: CTRL-C in the GUI doesn't interrupt · vim/vim@4e1d8bd
attachments.text: Problem: CTRL-C in the GUI doesn't interrupt. (Sergey Vlasov) Solution: Recognize "C" with CTRL modifier as CTRL-C. (issue #6565)

Solution:   Guess variable type based in index type. (issue #6591)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/b86abadf87bd0f85f800077171ec4b98aefff776|patch 8.2.1340: some tests fail on Cirrus CI and/or with FreeBSD>
patch 8.2.1340: some tests fail on Cirrus CI and/or with FreeBSD

Problem:    Some tests fail on Cirrus CI and/or with FreeBSD.
Solution:   Make 'backupskip' empty. Do not run tests as root. Check for
            directory when using viminfo. (Ozaki Kiichi, closes #6596)
